title: Let's talk Rankings
body:
Let's just talk and discuss.

I just played a normal game, so that may be a part of what I will be saying, but non the less, 5 Silver 3/4 on the enemy team, 3 of which were premade at least, on my team we had one platinum 4 and 4 un-ranked, 2 of which were premade.

The 5 Silver were nothing but talk, shit talking too, very abusive and were just bad. They took 2 towers to 6 and a score of 19 - 36.

I know Silver means not much and in Normals means nothing for matchmaking, yet I see a fair few Silver ranked players who play the way they talk, like rubbish, shit talking everyone and playing just as bad.

Bronze players are just terrible, Silver players are terrible and talk big. To be a Silver 4 and play that badly, is it too easy to get rank at the early stages of ranking? When does the ranks actually show when you are decent? And does rank change normal Matchmaking in anyway?

replies.body:
To a silver player, a bronze player looks bad. To a gold player, that silver player looks bad. To a challenger player a diamond player looks bad. "decent" is relative to the guy looking and you wont find any consensus on that. 

And rank doesnt mean much in normals, a lot of people use normals to play troll stuff or try out champs they've never played before so won't be playing at the same level they would in ranked. There's also people that got to the rank they are by playing one champ or cheese strategy well, and are bronze 5 level if they're playing anything else. i wouldn't read into it much
